skill.name: perplexity-search
skill.description: Perform AI-powered web searches with real-time information using Perplexity models via LiteLLM and OpenRouter. This skill should be used when conducting web searches for current information, finding recent scientific literature, getting grounded answers with source citations, or accessing information beyond the model's knowledge cutoff. Provides access to multiple Perplexity models including Sonar Pro, Sonar Pro Search (advanced agentic search), and Sonar Reasoning Pro through a single OpenRouter API key.

security_audit.summary: No credential harvesting, obfuscation, or suspicious execution paths were found. Network usage is limited to documented model calls via LiteLLM and OpenRouter. File access is limited to optional .env creation and user requested output files.

content.user_title: Run real time Perplexity web searches
content.value_statement: Finding recent research is slow and unreliable. This skill runs Perplexity searches through OpenRouter and returns grounded answers with sources.
actual_capabilities: Send a query to Perplexity models through LiteLLM
Select Perplexity model by CLI option
Control max tokens and temperature per request
Save results to a JSON file
Check setup for API key and dependency status
limitations: Requires a valid OpenRouter API key and credits
Requires LiteLLM installed in the runtime
Results depend on external model and network availability
Citations may not be present in every response

use_cases.title: Track recent publications
use_cases.description: Find 2023 to 2024 studies with sources for a specific scientific topic

use_cases.title: Verify technical details
use_cases.description: Confirm current library behavior and link to official references

use_cases.title: Compare approaches
use_cases.description: Request a grounded comparison of competing methods with citations

prompt_templates.title: Quick fact check
prompt_templates.prompt: What were the main 2024 updates to CRISPR base editing? Provide source citations.

prompt_templates.title: Literature scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Find 2023 to 2024 peer reviewed studies on gut microbiome in Parkinson disease. Summarize key findings and cite sources.

prompt_templates.title: Technical comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare PyTorch and TensorFlow for transformer training in 2024, including performance benchmarks and sources.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced synthesis
prompt_templates.prompt: Using sonar-pro-search, analyze CAR-T therapy advances since 2023, including mechanisms, trials, and outcomes with citations.

output_examples.input: Summarize 2024 clinical trial results for CAR-T in B cell lymphoma with sources.
output: Key trial outcomes with response rates and sample sizes
Notable adverse events and safety notes
Primary sources and links for each trial

best_practices: Specify time range and domain in the query
Choose the model that matches complexity and budget
Set max tokens to control response length and cost
anti_patterns: Use vague one word queries with no context
Share or commit your API key in a repository
Run large batches without monitoring OpenRouter usage

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, or Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a CLI and Python skill that can be invoked from any of those platforms.

faq.question: What usage limits should I expect?
faq.answer: Limits come from your OpenRouter account, rate limits, and model specific pricing.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into my Python project?
faq.answer: Yes. Import search_with_perplexity from scripts/perplexity_search.py and call it directly.

faq.question: Does it store or transmit my API key?
faq.answer: It reads OPENROUTER_API_KEY from the environment and does not transmit it outside OpenRouter.

faq.question: What should I do if I see setup errors?
faq.answer: Run python scripts/setup_env.py --validate and install LiteLLM if missing.

faq.question: How does it compare to built in model knowledge?
faq.answer: It uses live web search through Perplexity for current sources beyond model training data.
